abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Zambia Social Investment Fund Project (ZAMSIF), which
            finances community grants for investing in social and
            economic infrastructure, and improving natural resources
            management. Negative environmental impacts will be
            alleviated by the following mitigation measures: Soil
            degradation will be reduced by watershed management
            activities that control erosion (using fast-growing tree
            crops, stabilizing exposed soil with grasses or other ground
            covering, designing terraces on hillsides), projects which
            encourage composting, activities to control forest and bush
            fires, increasing drought preparedness, and improving
            management of communal grazing. Deforestation will be
            reduced by establishing community managed wood lots and
            forestry management, employing reforestation, establishing
            tree nurseries, improving use of fuel resources, and
            creating greenbelts in urban areas. Air and water pollution
            will be controlled by disposing of solid and hazardous
            waste, collecting garbage, recycling waste, improving
            drainage with small-scale works, building communal latrines,
            and filling quarries. To prevent the incidence of disease,
            bore holes will be located away from toilets and waste
            disposal facilities as will a separate waste disposal system
            for medical wastes and other non-infectious waste, and the
            public will be educated in proper sanitation, health, and hygiene.
